abstract: Alibaba said that the chief executive, David Wei, and the chief operating officer, Elvis Lee, were not involved in the fraud but that they had resigned for failing to stop it.
snippet: Alibaba said that the chief executive, David Wei, and the chief operating officer, Elvis Lee, were not involved in the fraud but that they had resigned for failing to stop it.
lead_paragraph: Alibaba.com, a fast-growing Chinese electronic commerce site that is partly owned by Yahoo, said on Monday that its chief executive and chief operating officer had resigned amid an internal investigation of fraud at the company.

headline.main: 2 Executives Quit Alibaba.com Amid Fraud Inquiry
headline.print_headline: Resignations At Alibaba After Fraud Is Uncovered
